intro: Gasteranthus pansamalanus, commonly known as the Panamanian urn flower, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Panama and is characterized by its unique urn-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, which is adapted for dispersal by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
